column1:
atlasjason,"2018-05-12T23:38:42.113Z","How do you get it?","

When I saw this added to
column4: to get one of these. This is what I found out.

column2: Falcon before Dec. 31 (have the black VIP card)

column1: I was told by Lego CS that a promotional code for the poster was sent on
column3: t get the email or a code but Lego CS was able to ship me the poster based on my account purchases.

column2: t seem to be helping people based on the feedback so let me shed some more light on the item at hand.

column3: wide, for easy reference it is the size of standard piece of paper. I am not sure how to compare the weight of the paper,&nbsp
column4: maybe a light postcard. It was smaller than I had expected but that will make it easy to find a frame. I was a little disappointed in the packing, it was in a flimsy envelope with no real protection for the poster (mine&nbsp
column5: had a small crease in the corner). Placing it between two pieces of cardboard would be much appreciated(and make them BIGGER). I really like the idea of the schematics and hope to see Lego&nbsp
column6: do the same with other UCS models in the future.&nbsp
